elements.title: The Other Woman

The Other Woman

Vulture · 16 min

Jennifer Coolidge spins roles as trophy wives and divorcées into comic gold. Now she gets to show what else she can do.

Harvard Business Review · 10 min

Why I’m glad that I’m an ‘overthinker’

The Guardian · 7 min

What If Regulating Facebook Fails?

WIRED · 10 min

Vox · 17 min

Fascinating stories

Here Is a Photo of a Single Atom

Popular Mechanics · 2 min

Do you see it? It’s tiny, but it’s visible.

I Signed Up to Write College Essays for Rich Kids. I Found Cheating Is More Complicated Than I Thought.

Slate · 5 min

“To my surprise, of the hundreds of clients I worked with, many—maybe most—students were simply desperate for the help.”

In 2030, You Won't Own Any Gadgets

Gizmodo · 9 min

By 2030, technology will have advanced to the point that even the idea of owning objects might be obsolete.

Ray Bradbury’s Greatest Writing Advice

Literary Hub · 15 min

“I’ve had a sign over my typewriter for over 25 years now: Don’t think!”

‘So, So Angry’: Reporters Who Survived the Capitol Riot Are Still Struggling

VICE · 15 min

The reporters who survived the insurrection are still covering Congress. But things don’t feel normal.

Do We Really Need to Take 10,000 Steps a Day for Our Health?

The New York Times · 3 min

The advice that we take 10,000 steps a day is more a marketing accident than based on science. Taking far fewer may have notable benefits.

The Secret to Being Witty, Revealed

Quartz · 5 min

Sixty years of climate change warnings: the signs that were missed (and ignored)

The Guardian · 19 min

The More Options You Have, The Happier You Are

Darius Foroux · 5 min

Did lead poisoning cause downfall of Roman Empire? The jury is still out

Ars Technica · 5 min

Here’s Why Your Body Stores More Fat in Certain Places

Popular Science · 6 min

Nature is just too good at stashing away our excess energy in the form of flab. And it’s hard to fight nature.

Why In-Law Relationships Can Be So Challenging

The Atlantic · 3 min

Tough conversations provide opportunities for pain and conflict, but also for growth and healing, “Dear Therapist” writes.

Poor Teeth

Aeon · 16 min

If you have a mouthful of teeth shaped by a childhood in poverty, don’t go knocking on the door of American privilege.

Why Water Is Weird

Nautilus · 4 min

What makes water unique among liquids?

How Einstein Learned Physics

Scott Young · 11 min

Einstein was a student long before he became a celebrity. There is a lot to glean from his education and unique approach to learning.
